articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi, Timour Azhari
articles.description: Insurgents gained control after only a day of fighting, leaving President Bashar al-Assad's 24-year rule dangling by a thread as rebels marched on Damascus.
articles.title: Syria rebels celebrate in captured Homs, set sights on Damascus

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Assad flew out of Damascus for an unknown destination early on Sunday.
articles.title: Iron-fisted Assad never quelled the Syrian rebels who came back to topple him

articles.author: Kuba Stezycki
articles.description: The Romanian far-right presidential candidate at the centre of a Russian electoral meddling scandal turned up at the place he would have voted in on Sunday, saying the Constitutional Court's decision to cancel the ballot was fatal for democracy.
articles.title: Romanian far-right candidate says democracy "cancelled" along with election

articles.author: Mike Stone
articles.description: The United States unveiled a $988 million aid package of new arms and equipment to Ukraine for its ongoing fight against Russia's invasion on Saturday.
articles.title: US readies $988 million aid package to Ukraine including rockets and drones

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan's defence ministry said on Sunday that China had nearly doubled the number of its warships operating around the island in the previous 24 hours, ahead of what security sources expect will be a new round of war games.
articles.title: Taiwan reports near doubling of Chinese warships nearby

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump said on Sunday that Russia's abandonment of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad led to his downfall, adding Moscow never should have protected him in the first place and then lost interest because of a war in Ukraine that never should have started.
articles.title: Trump says Russia abandoned Syria's Assad, never should have been involved

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The sudden collapse of Bashar al-Assad's rule over Syria marks the culmination of a nearly 14-year rebellion and a key moment in a civil war that killed hundreds of thousands of people, displaced half the population and drew in outside powers.
articles.title: Assad's fall followed years of bloodshed and division

articles.author: Ingrid Melander, Ardee Napolitano
articles.description: Paris' Notre-Dame Cathedral reopens its doors on Saturday, five-and-a-half years after it was ravaged by a devastating fire that destroyed its spire and roof and brought the entire Gothic masterpiece within minutes of collapsing.
articles.title: Notre-Dame Cathedral reopens on Saturday, five years after fire

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer will visit Cyprus on Tuesday as part of a regional tour, the island's presidency said on Sunday.
articles.title: British Prime Minister Starmer to visit Cyprus on Tuesday, Cyprus says

articles.author: Maxwell Adombila, Christian Akorlie
articles.description: Ghana's former President John Dramani Mahama has staged a political comeback by winning the West African nation's presidential election after his rival Vice President Mahamudu Bawumia conceded defeat on Sunday.
articles.title: Ghana's former President Mahama wins election
